intro: Actinostemma lobatum var. japonicum, commonly known as Japanese starwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It features a slender, branched stem with opposite, ovate leaves that have a finely toothed margin. Its small, white flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family, and bloom in early summer.
